page.text:
Материалы и Вы Руководство об инструметах
Часть 2 Автор Skyla
Контент

Добро пожаловать во второе издание книги Материалы и Вы: Руководство об инструметах. С помощью этой книги Вы более подробно узнаете обо всех инструментах, материалах и модификаторах. Тут всё разобрано по полочкам, но кое о чём тут всё же не написано.
Это книга - магическая копия; она обновляется, когда её оригинал изменяется. Иногда в ней появляется новая информация о новых предметах, следите за обновлениями.

page.title: Кирка
page.text: Кирка - это базовый инструмент любого шахтёра. Это самый простой способ добывания камня и руд.
Класс: Точный инструмент Эффективен для: Камня или булыжника, руд и металлов.

page.title: Лопата
page.text: Лопата - это базовый инструмент для копания. Это наиболее распространенный способ изменения ландшафта.
Класс: Точный инструмент Эффективен для: Земли, песка, песчанника и снега.

page.title: Топорик
page.text: Топорик - это основной инструмент для срубания. Это самый простой способ добыть древесину.
Класс: Точный инструмент Эффективен для: Древесины, листьев и деревьев.

page.title: Мотыготопор
page.text: Мотыготопор - это универсальный инструмент для сельского хозяйства. Его основная цель - разрыхлять почву. Также, его можно использовать как топор и лопата, но он не является их заменой.
Класс: Мультиинструмент Эффективен для: Древесины, земли и растений.

page.title: Палаш
page.text: Палаш - оборонительное оружие. Это любимое оружие многих инженеров, который полезен самых разных ситуациях.

ПКМ: Блок - Блокирование уменьшает повреждения в два раза.
Класс: Оружие ближнего боя Эффективен против паутины.

page.title: Полуторный меч
page.text: Полуторный меч - наступительное оружие. Он испльзуется для быстрой атаки.

ПКМ: Прыжок - При отпускании, он отбрасывает вас вперёд с головокружительной скоростью.
Уже имеющиеся способности: - Ускоренный заряд, во время бега он дальше отбрасывает, наносит в 1.5x урона больше.
Класс: Оружие ближнего боя Эффективен против паутины.

page.title: Rapier
page.text: The Rapier is a special weapon. The dancing swordplay lets you get in and out of battle quickly. While the Rapier's damage is low, it makes up for this with its other abilities.

Right-click: Backpedal - Take a small hop backwards
Natural Abilities: - Charge Boost, does 1.5x damage and knockback while sprinting. - Armor Pierce, ignores armor and blocking. - Quick Strike, the enemy is stunned for less time.
Class: Melee Weapon

page.title: Dagger
page.text: The Dagger is a short weapon. It is light and usable as both a striking and throwing weapon.

Right-click: Throw Dagger - Toss the item for a ranged attack
Class: Ranged/Melee Weapon

page.title: Frying Pan
page.text: The Frying is a heavy weapon that uses sheer weight to stun foes or a place to cook your food. It is common to hunt pigs and cook them with the same pan.

Right-click: Block - Blocking cuts a wide variety of damage types in half.
Shift+Right-click: Place Item - The frying pan cooks a large amount of food at a time.
Natural Abilities: - Bash, does extra knockback and stuns the foe.

page.title: Battlesign
page.text: The Battlesign is an advance in weapon technology worthy of Zombie Pigmen everywhere.

Right-click: Block - Blocking cuts a wide variety of damage types in half.
Shift+Right-click: Place Item - The battlesign can show up to five lines of text.
Class: Lethal Joke Weapon

page.title: Chisel
page.text: The Chisel is an advanced detailing tool for carving shapes into blocks.

Right-click: Chisel - Transforms various blocks into bricks. Crafting grid: Chisel - Some items can only be chiseled in the crafting grid.
Class: Utility Tool

page.title: Hammer
page.text: The Hammer is a heavy mining tool meant for digging out large areas. It is also effective on undead.

Natural Abilities: - Area of Effect, Mines a 3x3 area. The direction depends on which face is pounded. - Smite II, Does 2-4 extra hearts of damage against undead. - Huge Durability, this tool has very high durability to make up for the constant beating it will recieve.
Class: Broad Mining Tool

page.title: Lumber Axe
page.text: The Lumber Axe is capable of bringing down whole trees or clearing large swaths of food in a single swing.

Natural Abilities: Fell Trees - Harvests entire trees. It has a max height of 30. Trees are defined as Leaves on top of Logs. Area of Effect - Mines a 3x3x3 area. This is a fallback if a tree is not found.
Class: Broad Mining Tool

page.title: Excavator
page.text: The Excavator is a large digging tool used for clearing out large swaths of land, gravel, or snow.

Natural Abilities: Area of Effect - Mines a 3x3 area. The direction depends on which face is scooped.
Class: Broad Mining Tool

page.title: Scythe
page.text: The Scythe is well known for its large swinging area. It can be used to harvest crops, leaves, and is a decent weapon.

Natural Abilities: Area of Effect - Attacks mobs in a 3x3x3. - Harvests a 3x3x3 area.
Class: Broad Melee Weapon

page.title: Cleaver
page.text: The Cleaver is a heavy defensive weapon. The sword is unwieldly, but the sheer weight of the tool crushes foes.

Right-click: Block - Blocking cuts a wide variety of damage types in half.
Natural Abilities: - Beheading II, Beheads mobs. Their head is dropped as loot. - Heavy, Base attack is increased at the cost of swing time
Class: Heavy Melee Weapon

page.title: Battleaxe
page.text: The battleaxe is an offensive melee weapon that can also bring down small trees.

Right-click: TBD - This ability is incomplete
Natural Abilities: - Area of Effect, harvests wood blocks in a 1x9 tower. - Bash, knocks the enemy further away than normal.
Class: Heavy Melee Weapon

page.title: Shortbow
page.text: The Shortbow is a weapon used to fire arrows. It has a quick, short range.

Right-click: Draw bow - The further a bow is drawn, the further an arrow flies and the more damage it does.
Class: Ranged Projectile Launcher

page.title: Arrow
page.text: Arrows are fired from bows as projectiles. They can also be used as stabbing weapons in a pinch.
Class: Ammunition

page.title: Material Traits
page.text:
Some materials have traits that augment their natural uses.
- Reinforced: 10% chance per level of not using durability - Stonebound: The tool mines faster as it wears out, but does less damage - Jagged: The tool attacks with does more damage as it wears out, but mines slower - Writable: One extra modifier per piece - Tasty: Sometimes drops food items

page.title: Wood
page.text: It seems to grow everywhere.

page.title: Stone
page.text: One of the most common materials in the world.

page.title: Iron
page.text: A staple for tools, it can be refined and processed. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Flint
page.text: More durable than stone. The material of choice for cavemen.

page.title: Cactus
page.text: A form of wood found only in the desert.

page.title: Bone
page.text: A material with many uses, dead or alive.

page.title: Obsidian
page.text: Tough as nails, but fragile when shaped.

page.title: Alumite
page.text: An uncommon alloy. It seems to be quite durable. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Netherrack
page.text: This is made of what?!

page.title: Blue Slime
page.text: Converting it from food has made it stronger.

page.title: Green Slime
page.text: Soft and springy, it seems to last forever.
Slimy Mud
Slime Crystal

page.title: Paper
page.text: It's very weak, but can take a lot of modification.
Paper Stack

page.title: Cobalt
page.text: One of the nether materials. It's bright blue. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Ardite
page.text: One of the nether materials. It seems to mine faster as it wears out. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Manyullyn
page.text: The nether alloy. It's stronger than diamond. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Copper
page.text: A common metal found in the ground. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Bronze
page.text: A common alloy. It's a bit better than iron. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Steel
page.text: An Iron alloy. The method for obtaining this is unknown. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Pig Iron
page.text: An Iron alloy. It seems to be made of blood, iron, and emeralds. - Requires the Smeltery

page.title: Diamond
page.text:
Adding a diamond to the edge of a tool seems to make it more resilient.
Effects: - 500 extra durability - Mining level increased to level 3
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Emerald
page.text:
Affixing an emerald to a tool's weakest point appears to make it more resilient.
Effects: - 50% more durability - Mining level increased to level 2
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Speed
page.text:
Adding redstone to a tool seems to increase its mining speed.
Effects: - Each redstone dust increases mining speed by 0.08. - At 50/50 the boost is 4.0, making a wood pickaxe equivalent in speed to iron. - Not useful on weapons
Type: Multi-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Auto-Repair
page.text:
Attaching moss to a tool infuses it with life. The tool appears to be capable of regenerating wear and tear.
Effects: - The tool slowly repairs itself - Sunlight speeds up the process
Type: Single-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Auto-Smelt
page.text:
Melting a lava crystal onto the end of a tool gives it the power of a furnace.
Effects: - Smelts blocks as they're harvested - Sets mobs on fire for 3 seconds - Stacks with Luck - Not compatible with Silky
Type: Multi-use Stackable: No
Ball of Moss
Lava Crystal

page.title: Luck
page.text:
Encrusting lapis on tools is a gift to the gods of luck. They will bless your tool with great fortune and loot.
Effects: - Adds fortune or looting, depends on tool type - Increases level at a maximum threshold, but has a chance of increasing before - Sometimes adds extra luck to the tool - Not compatible with Silky
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Sharpness
page.text:
Adding quartz to the edge of a tool seems to make it sharper.
Effects: - Increases attack damage - Has less of an effect on tools with piercing properties
Type: Multi-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Fiery
page.text:
Adding blaze powder to a tool gives it a fiery tinge.
Effects: - Sets enemies on fire - Every 5 powder adds another second to the flame.
Type: Multi-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Necrotic
page.text:
Placing the bone of a Wither Skelton on a tool gives it nefarious life-stealing powers.
Effects: - Heals the player every time a monster is attacked - Heals one heart per bone
Type: Single-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Silky
page.text:
Adding a large glob of alunimum brass or gold and a bunch of string seems to give the tool silky-smooth properties.
Effects: - Allows blocks to be harvested directly - Scythes modified with Silky act as shears on blocks - Not compatible with Luck or Auto-Smelt
Type: Single-use Stackable: No
Silky Cloth
Silky Jewel

page.title: Reinforced
page.text:
Adding an obsidian plate to the tool seems to help with its durability.
Effects: - Adds the material trait Reinforced to the tool - Stacks with previous levels of Reinforced
Type: Single-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Knockback
page.text:
Attaching a piston to the tool and activating it at the right time seems to throw mobs further away.
Effects: - Adds extra knockback to the tool.
Type: Multi-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Beheading
page.text:
Working an ender pearl and some obsidian on a weapon has the curious effect of separating the target's head from its body.
Effects: - Beheads mobs. Enemies drop their heads as a result.
Type: Single-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Bane of Arthropods
page.text:
Striking a spider with its own eyeball causes it to recoil in fear.
Effects: - Does extra damage to spiders. - 1-2 hearts per level.
Type: Multi-use Stackable: Yes

page.title: Smite
page.text:
The raw power of consecrated soil empowers your weapon, smiting enemies from on high.
Effects: - Does extra damage to undead. - 1-2 hearts per level.
Type: Multi-use Stackable: Yes
Graveyard Soil
Consecrated Soil

page.title: Flux
page.text:
Adding a Hardened Flux Capacitor or Leadstone Energy Cell gives a tool energy. The tool still functions properly when the Cell/Capacitor has no charge.
Effects: - Allows the tool to be charged with Redstone Flux - Uses energy instead of durability while charged - Available from Thermal Expansion - Tools must have at least 1/1000th of the batteries capacity in durability
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Flux
page.text:
Adding a Hardened Flux Capacitor or Leadstone Energy Cell gives a tool energy. The tool still functions properly when the Cell/Capacitor has no charge.
Effects: - Allows the tool to be charged with Redstone Flux - Uses energy instead of durability while charged - Available from Thermal Expansion
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Additional Modifiers
page.text:
Working the tool with a block of gold and a diamond makes the tool more malleable, allowing for more modification.
Effects: - Adds an additional modifier slot to the tool
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Additional Modifiers
page.text:
Attaching a solid gold apple and encrusting the tool with a block of diamond warps the tool in places you did not notice before.
Effects: - Adds an additional modifier slot to the tool
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Additional Modifiers
page.text:
Working the tool with a nether star gives it the ability to attach parts they would not otherwise stay.
Effects: - Adds an additional modifier slot to the tool
Type: Single-use Stackable: No

page.title: Additional Modifiers
page.text:
For the creative types or the map makers in the world, this item is for you.
Effects: - Adds an additional modifier slot to the tool - If it has a target lock, it will only work on that tool.
Type: Single-use Stackable: Yes
